article.title: In Photos: 30th Annual Santa Barbara International Film Festival
article.description: Every year, some of Hollywood’s biggest actors and directors, as well as rising filmmakers make their way to the Downtown Santa Barbara for two weeks, receiving various awards and watching numer...
article.content:
Every year, some of Hollywood’s biggest actors and directors, as well as rising filmmakers make their way to the Downtown Santa Barbara for two weeks, receiving various awards and watching numerous new films. The Daily Nexus was able to get up close and personal and interview stars such as Jennifer Aniston, Felicity Jones and Michael Keaton.

Photos by Lorenzo Basilio

Thursday, Jan. 29: Cinema Vanguard Award honoring Eddie Redmayne and Felicity Jones

Felicity Jones of The Theory of Everything. (Lorenzo Basilio/Daily Nexus)

Eddie Redmayne of The Theory of Everything. (Lorenzo Basilio/Daily Nexus)

More coverage about the Cinema Vanguard Award HERE

 

Friday, Jan. 30: Montecito Award honoring Jennifer Aniston

Jennifer Aniston poses on the red carpet for her tribute event. (Lorenzo Basilio/Daily Nexus)

(Lorenzo Basilio/Daily Nexus)

More coverage on the Montecito Award HERE

 

Saturday, Jan. 31: Maltin Modern Master Award honoring Michael Keaton

(Lorenzo Basilio/Daily Nexus)

(Lorenzo Basilio/Daily Nexus)

More coverage on the Maltin Modern Master Award HERE

 

Sunday, Feb. 1: Virtuosos Award honoring Chadwick Boseman, Ellar Coltrane, Logan Lerman, David Oyelowo, Rosamund Pike, J.K. Simmons, and Jenny Slate

Rosamund Pike (Gone Girl) received the Virtuosos award. (Lorenzo Basilio/Daily Nexus)

Ellar Coltrane of Boyhood arrives at the Arlington Theatre. (Lorenzo Basilio/Daily Nexus)

Logan Lerman was one of the seven recipients of the Virtuosos Award. (Lorenzo Basilio/Daily Nexus)

Jenny Slate (Obvious Child), recipient of the Virtuosos Award. (Lorenzo Basilio/Daily Nexus)

David Oyelowo recalls his experience preparing for the role of Martin Luther King. Jr in the film Selma. (Lorenzo Basilio/Daily Nexus)

Chadwick Boseman accepts his Virtuosos Award for his role as James Brown in Get on Up. (Lorenzo Basilio/Daily Nexus)

(Left to right): David Oyelowo, Logan Lerman, Ellar Coltrane, Rosamund Pike, J.K. Simmons, Chadwick Boseman, and Jenny Slate receive their Virtuosos Award. (Lorenzo Basilio/Daily Nexus)

More coverage on the Virtuosos Award, including interviews with all recipients HERE

 

Thursday, Feb. 5: American Riviera Award honoring Patricia Arquette and Ethan Hawke

Ethan Hawke with a smirk as he walks down the red carpet. (Lorenzo Basilio/Daily Nexus)

Patricia Arquette speaks on behalf of her American Riviera Award with co-star Ethan Hawke from Boyhood. (Lorenzo Basilio/Daily Nexus)

Ellar Coltrane (middle) gave a speech honoring his Boyhood co-stars Ethan Hawke and Patricia Arquette for their American Riviera Award. (Lorenzo Basilio/Daily Nexus)

More coverage on the American Riviera Award HERE

 

Friday, Feb. 6: Outstanding Performer of the Year Award honoring Steve Carell

Steve Carell takes selfies with fans. (Lorenzo Basilio/Daily Nexus)

Steve Carell revisits his film career during his tribute event on Feb. 5 (Lorenzo Basilio/Daily Nexus)

Jennifer Garner made a surprise visit as she presents the Outstanding Performer of the Year Award to Steve Carell. (Lorenzo Basilio/Daily Nexus)

Steve Carell wins Outstanding Performer of the Year for his role in Foxcatcher. (Lorenzo Basilio/Daily Nexus)

More coverage on the Outstanding Performer of the Year Award HERE

 

Saturday, Feb. 7: Closing Night screening of McFarland, U.S.A.

The seven boys who portrayed the high-school cross country team in McFarland, USA. (Lorenzo Basilio/Daily Nexus)

The cast of McFarland, USA. (Lorenzo Basilio/Daily Nexus)

Kevin Costner and his wife Christine Baumgartner. (Lorenzo Basilio/Daily Nexus)

More coverage on the closing night and the screening HERE

related.title: In Photos: Second Annual Welcome to Paradise Festival
related.description: The Daily Nexus hosted the second annual Welcome to Paradise Festival on Tuesday. Students gathered in Storke Plaza to enjoy cotton candy, popcorn, henna tattoos, poetry-to-go and more. Opener Brandi ...
related.content:
The Daily Nexus hosted the second annual Welcome to Paradise Festival on Tuesday. Students gathered in Storke Plaza to enjoy cotton candy, popcorn, henna tattoos, poetry-to-go and more. Opener Brandi Rose Lentini and headliner The Hypno Rings performed live at the event.

Photos by Daily Nexus Photographers.

Brandi Rose performs Amy Winehouse’s “Valerie”. Jenny Luo / Daily Nexus
Gauchos pick up new Daily Nexus stickers. Jenny Luo / Daily Nexus
Christina DeMarzo / Daily Nexus
Gauchos relax in the shade while enjoying popcorn and live performances. Jenny Luo / Daily Nexus
The Hypno Rings played their set during the festival. Jenny Luo / Daily Nexus
Christina DeMarzo / Daily Nexus
Jenny Luo / Daily Nexus
Woodstock’s hands out free pizza to students. Christina DeMarzo / Daily Nexus
Representatives from Isla Vista Food Co-op hand out chips as prizes. Jenny Luo / Daily Nexus
Dustin Harris / Daily Nexus
Dustin Harris / Daily Nexus
Dustin Harris / Daily Nexus
Zack Zimmerman writes poetry to-go. Jenny Luo / Daily Nexus

This slideshow requires JavaScript.

related.title: In Photos: Black Lives Matter Rally
related.description: Over 150 people attended a rally organized by Santa Barbara High School students from the local chapter of Ethnic Studies Now on Thursday.
related.content:
Over 150 people attended a rally organized by Santa Barbara High School students from the local chapter of Ethnic Studies Now on Thursday. UC Santa Barbara students, parents, children and local residents marched from State Street to Stearn’s Wharf with signs and loudspeakers to call for an end to police brutality in the United States. Photos by Jenny Luo.

Jenny Luo / Daily Nexus

related.title: In Photos: UCSB Washed Away by Rain
related.description: Mother Nature delivered much needed rain on Tuesday. UCSB students tried their best to deal with the downpour.
related.content:
Mother Nature delivered much needed rain on Tuesday. UCSB students tried their best to deal with the downpour.

Photo credits: Stephen Manga, Cameryn Brock

A student browses on her phone outside of the UCen. Cameryn Brock/Daily Nexus

A student walks back to the Santa Cruz residence hall after class. Stephen Manga/Daily Nexus

A student jogs through the rain outside the San Nicolas residence hall. Stephen Manga/Daily Nexus

The rain puddles on campus were deep, and many students came to class with soaked feet. Stephen Manga/Daily Nexus

A student tries to skateboard through puddles on campus during the downpour on Tuesday. Stephen Manga/Daily Nexus

A student forgot to bring an umbrella with her to class, and got soaked as a result. Stephen Manga/Daily Nexus

Students struggle through the rain outside the De La Guerra dining commons. Stephen Manga/Daily Nexus

Students wait outside the UCen after a fire alarm triggered the evacuation of the entire building shortly after noon. Cameryn Brock/Daily Nexus

A maintenance worker wades through the deep puddles while a firetruck passes by the UCen. Stephen Manga/Daily Nexus

Students call their friends to let them know that the UCen has been evacuated. Stephen Manga/Daily Nexus

Firefighters arrived at the UCen several minutes after the fire alarm was triggered. No fire threats were found. Stephen Manga/Daily Nexus

A groundskeeper removes fallen palm tree branches outside the residence halls near campus. Stephen Manga/Daily Nexus
